Question 40.Question: Please describe any differences in how it impacted your learning (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 40.Response: The GenAI feedback was more generalised and provided less specific examples or critices but was more encompassing. Enabling me to focus on every part of a project. Where as my teacher would provide super short feedback (as they have multiple classses to review) and as such, would be less useful but more precise, criticing a few exact sections.

Question 41.Question: Were there any differences in how the feedback made you feel (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 41.Response: GenAI was more technical and didn't change how I felt about my work nor the GenAI tool. Multiple times my teacher's feedback has been "tone deaf" and at times rather hypocritical. Especially with international teachers who use english as a second language, their own work will be worded poorly, but because they have an english speaking marker helping them, I lose marks. Incredibly unfair.

Question 42.Question: Describe any other differences between the feedback you received from GenAI and your teacher.
Question 42.Response: Teachers are often overworked for the task they need to complete where as GenAI tools are exponentially developing and as such, can bear the front of inputs. I'll get a faster iteration process with GenAI than I would any teacher. The on-demand aspect of GenAI makes it a valuable time-saving tool. but teacher feedback is still unprecidented.
